lines.text: What I'm saying is, back when we first met, you were all like "Oh phooey, I burned the darn muffins." Now, you go into a bar, ten minutes later, sailors come runnin' out. What up with that?
I'm always frank and earnest with women. Uh, in New York I'm Frank, and Chicago I'm Ernest.
Chefs do that.
Mommy, am I gonna die?
Oh, no, baby, no. You're not going to die. They are. Cover your ears. Hey, should we get a dog?
I'm leaving the country, Mitch. I need a fake passport and I need money, lots of it.
Well why didn't you say so? Hold on a minute while I pull that outta my ass.
Life is pain. Get used to it.
Easy, sport. I got myself outta Beirut once, I think I can get outta New Jersey.
Yeah? Well, don't be so sure. Others have tried and failed. The entire population, in fact.
Alice, please. Your dog, Alice. It and my appetite are mutually exclusive.
Well, what's wrong with the dog?

Simple. He's been licking his asshole for the last three straight hours. I submit to you that there is nothing there worth more than an hour's attention. I should think that whatever he is attempting to dislodge is either gone for good, or there to stay. Wouldn't you agree?
Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
I hope not, 'cause I'm thinking how much my balls hurt.
I'm hurt real bad. I think I'm dying.
Continue dying. Out.
You're telling me that you're gonna fake some terrorist thing, just to scare some money out of Congress?
Well, unfortunately, Mr. Hennessey, I have no idea how to fake killing 4,000 people - so we're just gonna have to do it for real. Blame it on the Muslims, naturally. Then I get my funding.

I will see to it you will spend the next ten years in prison getting ass fucked, and if the case is thrown out because my case was too violent, I will personally hire men to ass fuck you for the next ten years, so if you're an ass fucking fan, you go ahead and mouth off.
Oh, shit! Ah, that hurt like shit!
I know. That's why I distracted you first. Same principle as deflowering virgins.
Huh? What? Virgin - ? What?
Read it in this Harold Robbins book. Guy bites her on the ear. Distracts from the pain. Ever try that?
No, no, I sock 'em in the jaw and yell, "Pop goes the weasel."
Oh honey, only four inches?
You'll feel me.
Goddamn it. You're early. So Perkins wants me dead, huh? What's the rush? Why don't you just go away and come back at midnight? Shoo.
Hey, honey, this is a real big fucking gun.
This ain't no ham on rye pal.
What the hell are you doing?
Saving your life. I would have been here sooner, but I was thinkin' up that 'ham on rye' line.
What happened?
I saved your ass. It was great.
[showing his knife to a woman and her kids]
You're about to have 2.4 children.

[singing]
Putting the keys in my left pocket. Hmm hmm hmm hmm hmm. Gun in the right-hand side.
It makes a bulge, people can see.
Ya want me to stick it in my pants and shoot my damn dick off?
Now you're a sharpshooter?
Die screaming motherfucker.
It's like I'm in goddamn prison. Do you know how that feels?
"YEAH. YEAH, I KNOW EXACTLY WHAT THAT'S LIKE. FOUR YEARS inside, Marion, Illinois. A REAL shithole. AND I'M NOT GOING BACK."
I'm goin' in.
You can't there's too many of them.
Well kill them for me, bitch! What else you good for?
Were you always this stupid, or did you take lessons?
I took lessons.
The last time I got blown, candy bars cost a nickel.
...It ain't over. You're going to die screaming... and I'm going to watch. Am I telling the truth?
Good evening, pretty lady. How 'bout some company?
No thanks. I'm saving myself 'til I get raped.
I know he has a pin in his leg, car accident. I... I know he cuts his own hair. He doesn't even own a TV. He... he sits when he pees...
Hey, hey, hey. That's enough, I'm gettin' a boner here, all right?
You foxy bitch.
Suck my dick, every one of you bastards.
How did you find us?

There may be many reasons not to kill you, but among them is not that you'll be missed by NASA. I found the address in your coat. Here. Between the address of a topless bar, and the picture of what looks like a man's penis.
That's a duck, not a dick.
[Charly jumps over a fence with a rifle and surprises Raymond]
Good morning, Raymond.
Good morning, Miss Caine.
What have we learned about the dangers of smoking? Give it here. Thanks. Tell anyone you saw me... I'll blow your fucking head off.
I can't!
Yes you can. You're one of the X-Men!
[Nathan hands his gun to Charlie, then pulls out a second]
Jesus, old man, how many of those you got?

Three. One shoulder, one hip and one down here, right next to Mr. Wally, where most patdowns never reveal it, as even the most hardened federal agent is often reluctant to feel up another man's groin. Any other questions?
Yeah. What's the weather like on your planet?

[singing to the song "I'd Really Love To See You Tonight" on the radio]
I'm not talking 'bout the linen... And I don't wanna change your life...
Movin' in.
Huh?
It's not linen. The song's not about linen.
Whatever. You cold?
I'm freezing.
Turn on the heater. It doesn't work, but it makes a very annoying noise which distracts from the cold.
I'll pass.
I let you touch me, cowboy. I think I need a bath.
You couldn't hit a lake if you were standing on the bottom.
I don't smoke, I don't drink and I don't swear. Oh shit, I DO smoke and drink!
They're gonna blow my head off, you know. This is the last time I'll ever be pretty.
I never did one thing right in my life, you know that? Not one. That takes skill.
What, are you a Mormon?
Yes, I'm a Mormon. That's why I just smoked a pack of Newport and drank three vodka tonics.
...everyone knows, when you make an assumption, you make an ass out of "u" and "umption".
We jumped out of a building.
Yes, it was very exciting. Tomorrow we go to the zoo.
You're Waldman.
No, I'm the Hill Brothers bean buyer. Who else would I be? Hang on. If you want me to talk in front of him, you may be asked... to kill him later. It works for me. Your call.
And what about your daughter, what's her name... Cathead?
Caitlin.
[Nathan says that Samantha Caine was a fantasy]
No. It's not a fantasy. I'm in the goddamn P.T.A...
Don't give me attitude, sir.
'Cause I'm a bad motherfucker !

[At the Christmas party]
As the year draws to a close... I would like to share with you just a few things about myself, things of which I'm especially proud. First, I am proud to say that I don't smoke, I don't drink and I don't swear. Oh shit, I do smoke and drink. To our dear friends, may the best of your past be the worst of your future.
Question. You keep saying "I this", "I that". Like well
[pause]
it's like you don't need me anymore.

[looks at Mitch]
Good point.
[opens passenger side door]
Hey, hey
[Charlie kicks him out of the car]
HEY!
[Mitch rolls a couple times and ends up on the sidewalk]

[sitting in the car, Mitch driving away from the chemical explosion, cars falling out of the sky]
Don't hit the cars!
Torture, yes, a woman's face never looked so quite beautiful as when it's distended in pain, witness the beauty of child birth.
Untie me and ill make any face you want.
Let's not and say we did.
Mommy, I hit my head!
And Charlie... you fuck with me, I'll blind the kid and shoot out her knees.
Sam... Ill be waiting for you to come and rescue me.
Be just a minute...

[shouting]
THAT'S RIGHT, YOU CAN'T KILL ME MOTHERFUCKERS!

As the year draws to a close... I would like to share with you just a few things about myself, things of which I'm especially proud. First, I am proud to say that I don't smoke, I don't drink and I don't swear. Oh shit, I do smoke and drink. To our dear friends, may the best of your past be the worst of your future.
I want my eye back, bitch!
Can I ask you something? Well, you seem kinda... low rent. No offense.

[chuckles]
None taken.
[after Mitch confesses that he's been in prison]

Eight years ago, I was an Atlanta cop. My partner and I worked this fraud case together. That motherfucker hated me! I forget why, but he did. Anyway, some bonds went missing from the evidence room, and, when someone called Internal Affairs and they went searching through my closet, lo and behold, what did they find?
The bonds. Your partner put them there, huh?
Oh no, I did. I stole the damn things.
[He laughs, and after an incredulous pause, Samantha joins in]
[while Mitch is creeping towards the truck to rescue Caitlin, Samantha covers him with a rifle. Two thugs appear and aim their guns at him, she takes them out quickly]
Gracias.
De nada.
